oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Liang, Kevin
Islam, Mohammad Tarequl
Hussain, Nora
Winkjer, Nathan S
Rowe, Lori A
Im, Monica
Boucher, Yan
Tarr, Cheryl L
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We sequenced the genomes of eight isolates from various regions of the United States that show high sequence similarity to Vibrio sp. 2521-89, a recently reported genome(1). These isolates form a monophyletic cluster clearly related but distinct from V. cholerae, representing a highly divergent basal lineage or a potential novel species.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
Taxonomy
Vibrio
Vibrio cholerae
